page.title: 02PARK FARM
page.content: Between 1924 and 1956 Park Farm Preserves Ltd. was a busy jam and canning factory. The produce for preserving came from all over the country e.g. rhubarb from Manchester and carrots from Ely. Blackcurrants were made into puree for Ribena. The sugar for all the preserves came from Tate & Lyle in Bishops Cleeve ( where Santa Fe have their depot today) in 2 cwt. sacks. In the summer between 60 and 70 people were employed dropping to 15 - 20 in the winter. The jams and canned foods were sent all over the country and some were exported. The factory closed in 1956 and became a pig farm. This information was given by Mr. F. Clayton of Gretton who worked at the factory.
